Description: Footring of vessel? Glazed composition segment of a doughnut shaped circular ring, or flange, with central hole, glazed on inner surface of cylindrical hole, and on outer curved surface, running round to middle of flat surfaces at top and bottom, with raised, thicker line of glaze at inner edge. Glaze not applied on inner half of the upper and lower surfaces either side of inner perforation, implying that it is part of a larger, composite object. Glaze pale bluey green, with discrete detachable surface where it survives on the inside of cylindrical hole. Core buff to white, fine hard texture.
Curator's comments: Large added ring bases are known from ovoid vases dated 1st century Bc to 1st century AD and 1st to 2nd century AD hemispherical bowls (Nenna 2013, Fig. 6.8, T12.4, see also Fig. 6.5. T7.4). Nenna, M.-D. and M. Seif el-Din. La vaisselle en faïece d’époque gréco- romaine. Études Alexandrines 4. Cairo: IFAO.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.14)
